item.title: Jose Mourinho pleads for FFP to help Manchester United catch Manchester City if they are to win the league again - The Independent
item.description:
Jose Mourinho pleads for FFP to help Manchester United catch Manchester City if they are to win the league again  The Independent

Jose Mourinho has claimed that Manchester United may need authorities to crack down on Manchester City’s spending before they can hope to challenge their rivals for the Premier League title again. Uefa last month opened an investigation into allegations, published in the German magazine Der Spiegel, that City illegitimately circumvented Financial Fair Play (FFP) regulations. Mourinho has regularly complained that United cannot match City’s clout in the transfer market since his arrival in Manchester and pointed to City’s spending power as a reason why United struggle to compete with their n...

item.title: Jose Mourinho claims he can't play £52m Fred while Manchester United look so fragile in defence - The Telegraph
item.description:
Jose Mourinho claims he can't play £52m Fred while Manchester United look so fragile in defence  The Telegraph

Jose Mourinho has claimed it is difficult for him to play Fred while Manchester United remain so susceptible defensively. Fred was United’s headline summer signing in a £52 million deal from Shakhtar Donetsk, but he has been a peripheral figure this season. The Brazil midfielder, 25, was omitted from United’s squad for Wednesday’s 2-2 draw against Arsenal at Old Trafford and has been an unused substitute in five of the past seven matches. United have conceded 25 goals in Premier League 15 matches - more than anyone bar the bottom five - and Mourinho believes that fragility is behind Fred’s ...

item.title: Jorge Mendes statement: Jose Mourinho is 'fully committed' to Manchester United - The Independent
item.description:
Jorge Mendes statement: Jose Mourinho is 'fully committed' to Manchester United  The Independent

Jose Mourinho’s agent Jorge Mendes has taken the unusual step of releasing a statement reaffirming his client’s commitment to Manchester United. Speculation over Mourinho’s Old Trafford future persists following a difficult start to the season, which sees United eight points back from the Premier League's top four after 15 games. Mendes rarely comments publicly or speaks on the record, though his agency Gestifute issued a rare statement on Friday refuting suggestions that Mourinho may leave United. “There have been more rumours of Jose Mourinho leaving Manchester United,” said Mendes, who a...

item.title: Manchester United 'very happy' with José Mourinho, says Jorge Mendes - The Guardian
item.description:
Manchester United 'very happy' with José Mourinho, says Jorge Mendes  The Guardian

José Mourinho’s agent, Jorge Mendes, has issued a rare statement in which he insists Manchester United’s manager is content at the club and the board are “very happy” with his client. Mourinho has cut an embattled figure for most of the campaign because of issues related to United’s summer transfer policy, his relationship with Paul Pogba and poor league form that has left his team 18 points behind the leaders, Manchester City, after 15 matches. Mendes’s move, then, will be viewed with interest. Related: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend “There have been more rumours of...

item.title: Eden Hazard now has attacking Chelsea manager, says Vincent Kompany - The Guardian
item.description:
Eden Hazard now has attacking Chelsea manager, says Vincent Kompany  The Guardian

Vincent Kompany has taken an apparent swipe at José Mourinho among others by saying Eden Hazard finally has an attack-minded manager at Chelsea who can get the best out of him. Hazard has played under Roberto Di Matteo, Rafael Benítez, Guus Hiddink and Antonio Conte as well as Mourinho at Chelsea since he joined in 2012. Kompany believes the arrival of Maurizio Sarri has been beneficial for his Belgium teammate. Related: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend “I think he was due an offensive manager,” the Manchester City defender said in the buildup to Saturday’s game at Sta...

item.title: Manchester United vs Fulham, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction? - The Telegraph
item.description:
Manchester United vs Fulham, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction?  The Telegraph

What is it? It's Manchester United against Fulham in the Premier League. Jose Mourinho was the first manager to welcome Claudio Ranieri back to England's top flight when he was appointed Fulham boss. Fulham, this weekend, visit Old Trafford, where Mourinho's United will hope to secure their first Premier League victory in five games, reuniting the pair for the first time since Ranieri's departure from Leicester. When is it? Saturday, December 8. What time is kick-off? 3pm. Newsletter Promotion - James Ducker's Man United briefingWhat TV channel is it on? Because it's a 3pm game, it's not on...

item.title: Rob Holding reveals get-well message from Marcus Rashford after Arsenal defender’s knee injury - The Independent
item.description:
Rob Holding reveals get-well message from Marcus Rashford after Arsenal defender’s knee injury  The Independent

Rob Holding has revealed that Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford has messaged him in the wake of receiving news that his season is over, having suffered a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament in a challenge by the England international. Holding collapsed midway through the first half of Arsenal’s 2-2 draw at Old Trafford on Wednesday and had to be carried off on a stretcher with his left leg in a brace, with scans revealing the worst on Friday. The 23-year-old is set to be out of action for up to nine months, ruling him out of the rest of the season and potentially that start of the 2...

item.title: Jose Mourinho press conference LIVE: Manchester United boss ahead of Fulham game, injury news latest - The Independent
item.description:
Jose Mourinho press conference LIVE: Manchester United boss ahead of Fulham game, injury news latest  The Independent

Jose Mourinho will hold a press conference on Friday morning ahead of Manchester United’s Premier League meeting with bottom-of-the-table Fulham at Old Trafford on Saturday. United remain eight points off their target of a top-four finish after drawing 2-2 with Arsenal in midweek and are still struggling to get their season off the ground. Mourinho praised the “heart” and “spirit” of his players on Wednesday night, having called their desire into question of late, but United are without a win domestically since the start of November. Basement-dwelling Fulham have conceded a staggering 36 go...

item.title: 'The club is very happy with him': Jose Mourinho given public backing via agent's statement - The Telegraph
item.description:
'The club is very happy with him': Jose Mourinho given public backing via agent's statement  The Telegraph

Jose Mourinho has been granted his wish of a formal assurance from Manchester United that his job is safe, with the club giving their blessing to a rare public statement from his all-powerful agent Jorge Mendes that there is no current prospect of a change at Old Trafford. The United manager goes into Saturday’s game at Fulham with just three points from his last four league games and the club eighth in the table, 18 behind leaders Manchester City. Once again he has experienced frustrations with gaining the public support of his club, as was the case three years ago at Chelsea. United have ...

item.title: Big Match Decoded: Why Chelsea must compete to win the midfield battle - The Telegraph
item.description:
Big Match Decoded: Why Chelsea must compete to win the midfield battle  The Telegraph

The big game on Saturday in the Premier League is at Stamford Bridge as Maurizio Sarri's side hosts title favourites Man City. Chelsea have fallen out of form in recent weeks and Sarri-ball isn't having quite the effect it was earlier in the season. Pep Guardiola is a master at figuring out how to stop his opponents playing their game and with City flying high in the league, could do some damage, if not end Sarris' ambitious title ambitions. Some key tactical decisions have to be made - where will the game be won and lost? How Man City are dominating games It's essential that Sarri figures ...

item.title: Jesse Lingard: Playing at the World Cup has taken its toll on my body - The Telegraph
item.description:
Jesse Lingard: Playing at the World Cup has taken its toll on my body  The Telegraph

Jesse Lingard has admitted that his exertions at the World Cup with England have taken their toll. The Manchester United forward has been suffering from a groin problem and, although he attempted to manage the inflammation, he had to eventually take a rest, missing games in October. “Coming off the World Cup, I played a lot of games over the course of last season and it kind of paid a toll,” the 25-year-old said. “We didn’t get much rest in the summer after the World Cup, so, coming back, there’s always going to be little niggles here and there. I wasn’t really 100 per cent fit, but I feel ...

item.title: Maurizio Sarri: 'Chelsea do not need to follow Pep Guardiola's example and spend £200m in the summer to win the title' - The Telegraph
item.description:
Maurizio Sarri: 'Chelsea do not need to follow Pep Guardiola's example and spend £200m in the summer to win the title'  The Telegraph

Maurizio Sarri has revealed that Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola warned him that he would not be able to improve all of his Chelsea players during his first year in charge. But head coach Sarri has ruled out following Guardiola’s example and spending £200 million to improve his squad at the end of his first season. Guardiola won his opening 10 games as City manager, but the club eventually finished the Spaniard’s first season third in the Premier League table and without a trophy. Sarri started life at Chelsea with an 18-game unbeaten run, but the Blues look on course for a battle to ...
